items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Flooding is possible throughout today, Saturday 12th March. Heavy rain over the last 24 hours has caused river levels on the Clyst and Culm to rise, and flooding to low lying land and roads is possible. Further heavy rain is forecast this evening and river levels are expected to remain high in the area. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels and will update this message on Sunday morning, 13th March, or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message:
Flooding is possible Saturday evening, 12th March, through to Sunday morning. Heavy rainfall is forecast this evening and this will cause river levels to rise in the River Teign area.

Current forecast suggests that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. We expect river levels to remain high overnight Saturday. 
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 

We are constantly monitoring river levels. This message will be updated on Sunday afternoon, 13th March, or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Saturday 12th March, Flooding is possible during this evening, into the early hours of Sunday morning. Heavy rainfall this evening and overnight will cause river levels to rise in the Otter, Sid and Exmouth areas. Bank-full conditions are expected with some localised riverside low lying land and roads flooding from this evening. We expect rivers to remain high overnight into Sunday morning. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels. This message will be updated on Sunday afternoon 13th March or earlier if the situation changes.
